page.title: 02The Docks Continued
page.content: Masons labourers and excavators who had come to build the dock and railway were housed by the Railway Company in the streets called Company Row and Dock Street. By the end of the 19th.century much of the trade of Penarth Dock had been taken by the new, larger dock at Barry. It gradually fell into disuse. It was used in the Second World War but was finally closed in 1962. Since then it has been used as an anchorage for pleasure boats and private yachts. Redevelopment has this year begun to change the area. The sea end (03180712) will be made into a marina for private moorings and two hundred houses while the land end will be filled in to accommodate industrial buildings. This is due for completion in 1992 at a cost of Â£12 million.
